meanings.definition: Prejudgers: Those who form an opinion or judgment without full knowledge or complete information.
meanings.sent1: The prejudgers in the class made assumptions about the new student without getting to know them.
meanings.sent2: It is important to avoid being prejudgers and instead seek to understand others before making conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The prejudgers at the party thought the cake was chocolate, but it turned out to be vanilla.
meanings.sent4: Her classmates were like prejudgers, quick to label her without knowing her true talents.
meanings.sent5: The prejudgers in the town spread rumors about the new family, causing unnecessary tension.
meanings.sent6: Despite being prejudgers, they were surprised to learn the truth about the situation.
meanings.sent7: Prejudgers often miss out on forming meaningful relationships due to their hasty judgments.

meanings.definition: Prejudgers: Individuals who hold biased or unfair views towards a particular group or individual.
meanings.sent1: The prejudgers in the community discriminated against people based on their appearance.
meanings.sent2: She realized she had been one of the prejudgers when she reflected on her past actions.
meanings.sent3: The prejudgers at the office were shocked to discover they had more in common than they thought.
meanings.sent4: His friends were like prejudgers, always making assumptions about others without giving them a chance.
meanings.sent5: The prejudgers in the group refused to listen to different perspectives, causing conflicts.
meanings.sent6: Despite being prejudgers, they were open to changing their views when presented with new information.
meanings.sent7: Prejudgers often harm themselves by limiting their own experiences and understanding of the world.
